meta.description: The ultimate guide to Home Loans: RLLR mechanics, Prepayment math, Hidden charges, Fraud prevention, and Negotiation scripts.

interest_rate_decoder.title: Interest Rates: RLLR vs MCLR
interest_rate_decoder.description: Understanding how your interest rate is calculated is the first step to saving money.

items.insight: RLLR = Repo Rate + Spread. When RBI cuts Repo Rate, banks MUST pass it on to you within 3 months. This is mandatory for all new floating rate retail loans since Oct 2019.
items.action: Ensure your loan is on RLLR, not MCLR.

items.insight: While Repo Rate is external, the 'Spread' is decided by the bank based on your credit risk. Banks insert a clause to 'Reset Spread' every 3 years. They use this to increase your rate even if Repo stays same.
items.action: Read the 'Reset Period' clause in your agreement. Longer reset periods (e.g. 5 years) are safer.

items.insight: If you are on an old high-interest regime (MCLR/Base Rate), you can switch to the new RLLR regime within the SAME bank by paying a 'Conversion Fee' (usually ₹2000-5000 + GST).
items.action: If your rate is > 0.5% above current offer rates, ask for a Conversion immediately.

prepayment_strategy.title: Prepayment: Kill the Loan Early
prepayment_strategy.description: How to become debt-free in 10 years instead of 20.

items.reason: When you prepay, banks ask: 'Do you want to reduce EMI or Tenure?'. Reducing Tenure saves lakhs in interest. Reducing EMI just eases monthly cashflow but keeps you in debt longer.
items.action: Tick 'Reduce Tenure' on the prepayment form.

items.insight: If you prepay just 10% of the outstanding principal once a year (e.g., using your bonus), you can close a 20-year loan in just ~10 years.
If you can't afford big prepayments, just paying 1 extra EMI equivalent every year (13 EMIs in a year) cuts ~3-4 years off a 20-year loan.

insurance_trap.title: The Insurance Bundling Trap
insurance_trap.description: Distinguishing between Mandatory and Optional covers.

items.insight: Banks legally require you to insure the *structure* of the house (against fire/earthquake) to protect their collateral. Cost is cheap (₹3-5k for 10 years).
items.action: Buy it. You can buy it from any insurer, not just the bank's partner.

items.insight: This covers your life. If you die, it pays the loan. Banks push this aggressively as a 'Single Premium' added to your loan amount. You pay interest on this premium!
items.action: REJECT IT. A standard Term Insurance plan is 5x cheaper and gives better coverage.

fee_decoder.title: The Real Cost: Visible & Hidden Fees
fee_decoder.description: Beyond interest, these are the charges you need to budget for.

charges.name: The 'Spread' Game (RLLR)
charges.insight: Your Rate = Repo Rate + Spread. Repo changes for everyone, but 'Spread' is specific to YOU. Banks often increase the Spread silently later (reset clause).
charges.action: Ensure the 'Spread' is constant for the loan tenure in your Sanction Letter.

charges.name: Processing Fee (PF)
charges.insight: Highly Negotiable! Ask for a 50-100% waiver during festive offers. Never pay this in cash to an agent.

charges.name: MODT / Notice of Intimation
charges.insight: Maharashtra caps this at ₹30k. Karnataka at 0.5%. Builders often collect 'Legal Fees' in cash which includes this—verify the actual government receipt.

charges.name: Legal & Valuation Charges
charges.insight: Paid to 3rd party lawyers/engineers. Ask if this is included in the Processing Fee or extra.

charges.name: Franking / Stamp Duty
charges.insight: State government tax on loan contract execution. Mandatory and non-negotiable.

charges.name: CIBIL / CERSAI Fees
charges.insight: Some banks charge ₹50 CERSAI fee with *every* construction-linked disbursement. Over 20 disbursements, this adds up.

charges.name: Login / Application Fee
charges.insight: Covers initial admin costs. Usually non-refundable even if loan is rejected. Demand a receipt.

safety_protocol.title: Fraud Prevention & Smart Moves
safety_protocol.description: Critical rules to avoid scams and bad deals.

checklist.explanation: Processing fees, login fees, or 'verification charges' should never be paid in cash to an agent.
Cheques must be payable to 'Bank Name - Loan Account'. Never issue cheques to an individual's name.
If an agent asks for a personal commission to 'guarantee' approval, it is a scam. Loan approvals are centralized.
Only switch banks if the new rate is >0.50% lower. The switching cost (PF + MODT + Valuation) consumes about 0.5% of the benefit.
Before switching, email your current bank: 'I am getting X% from Bank B. Match it or I close.' They often reduce your rate for a small conversion fee (₹2k-5k).
Every time you formally apply for a loan, your CIBIL drops by a few points. Do not apply to 5 banks at once. Shop around informally first.
Every payment must have a printed receipt with a Transaction ID.

common.note: CRITICAL. When depositing property papers, demand an official 'LOD' on bank letterhead. You need this to get papers back.
If doing a Balance Transfer, the existing bank will delay this. Escalate to Nodal Officer if delayed > 7 days.
PAN, Aadhaar (Address must match residence or provide Rent Agreement).
Keep one cheque ready favoring the lender.

salaried.note: Last 6 months (Salary account). Ensure no cheque bounces.

self_employed.note: GST Registration / Shop Act (min 3 years vintage).

property_documents.note: Chain of ownership for past 13-30 years.

clauses.norm: Banks add ₹1-2L 'Loan Protection Policy' to your loan. You pay interest on this premium for 20 years! It is OPTIONAL per RBI.
clauses.action: Reject it. Use your existing Term Insurance (5x cheaper).

clauses.red_flag: Clause allowing bank to change 'Spread' arbitrarily
clauses.norm: Only Repo Rate should change. Spread should remain constant.
clauses.action: Ask agent: 'Is the Spread fixed for the entire tenure?'

clauses.norm: RBI Mandate: ZERO penalty for floating rate home loans for individuals.
Penalty for missed EMIs is typically 2% per month (24% p.a.) on the overdue amount.
clauses.action: Be aware of this high cost of bouncing a cheque.

clauses.norm: Sometimes loans are sanctioned but money isn't released due to property issues.
clauses.action: Ensure sanction is 'Unconditional' before paying builder booking amount.

agent_script.title: Negotiation Scripts
questions: What is the Repo Spread? Is it fixed for the entire tenure?
Is the Loan Insurance mandatory? Please show me the RBI circular.
Can you waive 50% of the processing fee?
Can you show me the official MODT charges receipt from the Sub-Registrar?
If I pre-pay part of the loan, will you reduce the Tenure or the EMI?
